author: BerlinerKindl

review: Who is this for? - Those interested in the interactive features of a smart-TV but who don't want to spend $500+.Why should I get it over the next? - Simply put there is no easy answer.  Amazon Fire TV is literally made for the middle of the road.  It's meant to be a crossover between TV/Tablet/Xbox (or other gaming)/Computer...and to its credit, it succeeds in most areas of concern.Who is this NOT for?1) Anyone who has ever hooked up a PC via HDMI and a wireless keyboard/game pad - If you've reached that point in the rabbit hole, nothing can satiate your needs beyond a better PC hooked up to a better TV...2) Xbox owners - Ever since they dropped the xbox live gold requirement to stream content, xbox has been my go-to for netflix, amazon prime, music streaming, etc.  Plus the games are exponentially better.3) Possibly PS owners...I don't know because I don't own one.Why should you maybe get Amazon Fire TV?If you're the type who likes some occasional mindless gaming, this is great.  It has app based gameplay that, to it's credit, is visually stunning with some of the better developed games.  Other than that, it's a box that gives your tv the ability to play movies, music, videos, show pictures, and play games.What to know?1) This box is really really small - it's about the size of a CD case, and about 2 of them thick.2) It CAN NOT support additional storage, so I'm not sure how the gaming things will work out in the future.3) When scanning through video selections, there is not a 'return to the beginning' when you reach the end.  You can push the back button, but it just seems a little careless when that feature is quite prevalent in most app based electronics.4) The voice commands work VERY well - and despite what others have said, you can type out selections if you don't wish to use your voice.5) If for some reason you own an xbox 360 or later, and still want to buy this - XBOX CONTROLLERS WORK WITH AMAZON TV!!!! Don't buy their controller if you have an xbox 360 controller

review: I like the concept but it didn't offer me enough selections for TV and movies for free. We don't need the music or other stuff so it wasn't a bargain for us. Both of us are over 58 yrs old. and it doesn't cater to our age group. I did the one month free but after we watched all the episodes of the ones we liked there were no more and sometimes there's only a couple of seasons of a TV program out of many seasons which is disappointing when you find what you like only to be able to watch a few shows. Maybe it will get better in the future.
